dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2382 IH: Permanent Flexibility for School Meals Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act and the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to eliminate certain Federal nutrition requirements, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Permanent Flexibility for School Meals Act.

section.header: Nutritional requirements for school lunch and school breakfast programs

subsection.header: Amendments to National School Lunch Act
subsection.text: The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1751) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 4(b)(1)(A) (42 U.S.C. 1753(b)(1)(A)), by striking (consisting of a combination of foods which meet the minimum nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary under section 9(a) of this Act);

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking and other program requirements and inserting guidelines;

subclause.text: by striking shall meet and inserting may meet;
by striking minimum nutritional requirements prescribed and inserting nutrition guidelines issued; and
by striking , except that the minimum nutritional requirements and inserting which; and
by striking complying with the nutritional requirements and inserting meeting nutrition guidelines;
by striking minimum nutritional requirements and inserting nutrition guidelines; and
by striking maintaining compliance with the requirements and inserting meeting nutrition guidelines; and

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Nutritional requirements and inserting Nutrition guidelines;
by striking requirements of this subsection each place it appears and inserting guidelines under this subsection; and
in paragraph (1), by striking shall serve and inserting may serve;

paragraph.text: in section 11(a)(1)(A) (42 U.S.C. 1759a(a)(1)(A)), by striking (consisting of a combination of foods which meet the minimum nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary pursuant to subsection 9(a) of this Act);

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking shall serve meals consisting of a combination of foods and meeting minimum nutritional standards prescribed by the Secretary and inserting may serve meals consisting of a combination of foods that meet nutrition guidelines issued by the Secretary; and
in paragraph (2), by striking complying with the nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary pursuant to this subsection and inserting meeting nutrition guidelines;

paragraph.text: in section 14(f) (42 U.S.C. 1762a(f)) by striking meet the minimum nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary under section 9(a) of this Act, and;

subclause.text: in the heading, by striking requirements and inserting guidelines; and

item.text: by striking shall and inserting may; and
by striking minimum nutritional requirements prescribed and inserting nutrition guidelines issued;

subclause.text: in clause (i), by striking update requirements and inserting update guidelines; and
in clause (ii), by striking updated requirements and inserting updated guidelines; and

clause.text: by amending paragraph (2)(C) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The nutrition guidelines issued under subparagraph (A) shall not be construed as—

clause.text: prohibiting institutions, family or group day care homes, and sponsored centers from substituting foods to accommodate the medical or other special dietary needs of individual participants; or
requiring an institution, family or group day care home, sponsored center, or emergency shelter from complying with such guidelines.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (o)(3)(A), by striking nutritional requirements and inserting nutrition guidelines; and
in subsection (u)(3), by striking nutritional requirements both places it appears and inserting nutrition guidelines; and

paragraph.text: in section 22 (42 U.S.C. 1769c), by striking nutritional requirements each place it appears and inserting nutrition guidelines.

subsection.text: Section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1758) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by striking subparagraph (D) and redesignating subparagraph (E) as subparagraph (D); and

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking Nutritional and other program requirements and inserting Nutrition guidelines;

clause.text: by striking shall meet minimum nutritional requirements prescribed and inserting may meet nutrition guidelines issued; and
by striking , except that the minimum nutritional requirements shall be measured by not less than the weekly average of the nutrient content of school breakfasts; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking nutritional requirements prescribed and inserting nutrition guidelines issued.
